sentences: Istun oma tegevusega enese huve kahjustama.
Kasutate loodust, aga tihti saete ise oksa, millel istute.
translation: to saw off the branch you are sitting on
to act against one's own interests
to cut down the tree you're perched in
context: The Estonian word 'istud' is the second person singular present form of the verb 'istuma', which means to sit. In this context, it's part of an idiomatic expression meaning to saw off or cut down a branch that one is sitting on - essentially acting against one's own interests in a self-destructive way. This idiom conveys the idea of making decisions that will ultimately harm oneself, similar to cutting away support beneath one's own position.
